ovdesc.p: The main file within this module, FRA.DEAL, is split into 3 distinct parts.

Part one stores the basic elements, either input or table generated defaults, essential to the FRA processing. Such details are; Counterparty ID, rates, type of FRA (Hedge or Trade), dates (Start, maturity and trade), and additionally, where appropriate, Broker ID's, commissions and charges and calculation parameters.

The second part of the record facilitates the settlement of the FRA deal, when, on rate fixing day, the prevailing settlement rate is input and actioned accordingly. Settlement accounts, addresses and relevant narratives for the delivery/receipt of advices and payments are picked up from here.

The third part stores the internally generated fields, providing accrual information, LCY equivalents of amount fields, status on advices and payments sent, and references to consolidation of generated transactions.

If for example, at the start date of a FRA, the customer requests the delivery of the settlement amount to his account that he maintains with American Bank A, Detroit which has an account with American Bank B, New York, the User will then make the following input:
(i) Default (or Enter) the standard Nostro account number in the SETTLEMENT.ACCT. This field is always used to indicate the account where the book-keeping entries must be recorded by the system.

(ii) Enter the Agent code (Customer number) of the American Bank B, New York, in BEN.BANK.1. In case this Bank does not exist on the Database, the User can then enter the name and address of this Bank in BANK.ADDR.

(iii) Enter the Agent code (Customer number) of the Bank of Detroit in this field. In case this Bank does not exist on the Database but there was a Customer reference for the Bank identified in the previous field, the User can enter the name and address of this Bank in BANK.ADDR. This means that at least one of the two banks must have been defined on the CUSTOMER and AGENCY files.

Indicates the value of the amount to be settled.

On the RATE.FIX.DATE of the FRA agreement, the fixed rate of the contract is compared with the settlement rate and counterparties settle between them the value of the interest rate differential on the agreed principal over the agreed period. Since the interest rate differencial is paid in advance at the START.DATE of the fixed rate period, the settlement amount is DISCOUNTED as per formula indicated in addendum. Thus, the settlement amount of a FRA is the profit or loss that is realised upon the settlement (START) date, and whose value is discounted back from the date of maturity.
1. When the SETTLEMENT.RATE is greater than the INTEREST.RATE of the FRA contract then:
- If the FRA contract is an Asset (SALE), then the settlement amount is a LOSS and the settlement amount will be displayed with a "-" (minus) sign.
- If the FRA contract is a Liability (PURCHASE), then the settlement amount is a PROFIT and the settlement amount will be displayed with a "+" (positive) sign.
2. When the SETTLEMENT.RATE is smaller than the INTEREST.RATE of the FRA contract then:
- If the FRA contract is an Asset (SALE), then the settlement amount is a PROFIT and the settlement amount will be displayed with a "+" (positive) sign.
- If the FRA contract is a Liability (PURCHASE), then the settlement amount is a LOSS and the settlement amount will be displayed with a "-" (minus) sign.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during input.

During the validation stage of a FRA contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, that the interest rate varies by more thatn the variation tolerance defined in the FRA parameters table.
In the event that the user confirms the Override, the full text of the actual Override Message will be stored, for reference purposes on in this multivalue field.

For example, if the user inserts an 'abnormal' interest rate in the field corresponding to the interest rate then when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads:
'VARIANCE OF RATE EXCEEDS PERMITTED TOLERANCE'

This will draw the user's attention to the rate entered, which may be a mistake and can then be corrected, or, on the other hand, it may be correct input and so the user confirms that this rate is really intended.

A second example might be in respect of a contract done with a client who has a credit line established with the bank but where the start date of the intended FRA contract goes beyond the credit line expiry date. In this case when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads:
'LINE EXPIRES BEFORE TXN START DATE'
Once again the user's attention is drawn to the situation and either corrected or conrimed via a positive response to the Override Message.
If, subsequently, the contract record is either fully displayed or printed, then all override messages will be present.

Specifies the underlying strategy of the FRA transaction. Two main types exist:
HEDGE <--------> TRADING

A distinction is made between the two in order to allow different accounting procedures to be implemented and for the timing of the recognition of profits and losses and as to when they are to be incorporated into the balance sheet.
HEDGE Transactions

Because the maturity dates of deposits and other sources of funds available in the market do not always sufficiently match the maturity of banks' assets, bankers make use of interest rate hedging instruments to reduce their interest gap exposure to acceptable limits. The FRAs have become today a popular alternative to Financial Futures as a means of hedging interest rate exposure. In order for a bank to enter into a FRA for hedging purposes, the following conditions will apply:

1. The bank must have net assets or liabilities which are subject to interest rate risk. This condition must exist after commitments and anticipated transactions reducing the risk have been taken into account.
2. The FRA transaction must be designated as a hedge and must reduce the interest rate risk on exposed assets and liabilities.

As it can be seen, a conscious decision is done at deal level and since FRAs may be tailored into individual requirements, it is easier for such a trade to qualify as a hedge than for normal exchange governed Financial Futures.
TRADING Transactions

Apart from Hedging facilities, bankers will operate for other purposes such as general trading and arbitrage. Since such activities may be deemed to be of a more speculative nature, the concept of revaluing such positions is of importance.

In order to allow the segregation of the above trade concepts, the input of trades requires the inclusion of the type of trade. This will allow the system to distinguish trades into their relevant categories both for accounting purposes and for revaluing.
H(edge), T(rading). Default none; Input is always mandatory.

All Trades should have a Unique Transaction Identifier (UTI) which is generated, communicated and matched
Determination of who generates the UTI should follow the existing industry best practices for that Asset class

The UTI.USI.API attached in OC.PARAMETER and invoked during FRA deal capture determines who is the party responsible for UTI generation and does the following. If a value is present during deal capture the API is not invoked, on the assumption that the UTI is generated and supplied by the other Counterparty. If no value is present during the deal capture, the API is invoked to determine the party responsible for generating the UTI. If the Other counterparty is responsible, still an UTI is generated with a suffix as TEMP to show that the UTI from the other counterparty is awaited and in the meantime, the reporting is done with a Temporary ID. If T24 Bank is responsible for UTI generation, then the same is generated without TEMP. Where a reporting has been made with UTI having TEMP as suffix and subsequently the Counterparty supplies the UTI, the following procedure has to be followed to ensure reporting with actual UTI. The field Action Type needs to be changed to E and record to be authorized. Later, the UTI field should be modified with the actual UTI received. Set the Action Type field to N and authorize the record. In this way, the previous reporting gets cancelled and the new reporting goes with correct UTI.
